unnormalised: ## Flash Sale Fever: Is Your Wallet Sweating Yet?
normalised: Flash Sale Fever: Is Your Wallet Sweating Yet?

unnormalised: Okay folks, Diwali is just around the corner and you know what that means: Flash Sale season is officially upon us! Forget about the weather forecast, *this* is the real indicator of impending doom (or maybe delightful discounts, depending on your self-control).
normalised: Okay folks, Diwali is just around the corner and you know what that means: Flash Sale season is officially upon us! Forget about the weather forecast, this is the real indicator of impending doom (or maybe delightful discounts, depending on your self-control).

unnormalised: Picture this: It's 2 AM, you're half asleep scrolling through Flipkart, convinced you need a new pressure cooker even though the old one from your *nani* is still perfectly functional. Suddenly, BAM! A flash sale for 60% off on kitchen appliances. Your heart races faster than a Mumbai local during rush hour. You tell yourself, "Just browsing, yaar." Five minutes later, you've somehow purchased a pasta maker you'll probably never use. Been there, done that, got the t-shirt (which, by the way, I bought during a flash sale).

unnormalised: These flash sales are more addictive than *jalebis* on a Sunday morning. They prey on our deepest desires: the desire for a good bargain and the fear of missing out (FOMO). Retailers like Amazon and Myntra are basically Dr. Evil of the e-commerce world, masterfully pushing our impulse buy buttons.
